Customer

To overfit with machine learning processes. at some of the stuff you guys are working on what is something like the low-hanging fruit from a machine learning perspective that you think almost any quant i don't want to say bolt on and improve the process but i do think there are certain things that are just sort of okay that is very simple to introduce and will very likely have some sort of robustness benefit to your portfolio i mean you and i were saying before things like subset resampling are just one of those like very trivial to implement concepts in portfolio optimization that just seems out of sample to do an incredibly good job at managing estimation risks

你们正在研究的一些东西中，从机器学习的角度来看，你认为哪些是低垂的果实？我的意思是，几乎任何量化分析师都可以轻松引入并改进流程，但我认为确实有一些东西非常简单，容易实施，并且很可能会为你的投资组合带来某种稳健性的好处。比如，我们之前提到的子集重采样，就是那种非常容易实现的概念，在投资组合优化中，它似乎能够非常有效地管理估计风险。

Customer
It's just the concept of ensembles, of boosting and bagging, of resampling. These are technically ideas that are derived from machine learning literature. But once you have moved through the process of strategy design for long enough, they actually become second nature. It's not something that you... you don't sort of go to the machine learning literature and learn that there's a name for it and then you use it. We've been using it for years. And then once you begin to dig into the literature in information science and machine learning, then you discover that there's a name for it and that there are mathematically rigorous ways to apply it and to measure ex ante what the expected benefits should be from these approaches. We've been leaning pretty heavily on this. We've been leaning pretty heavily on concepts like bagging unsupervised learning, where you're creating clusters of similar assets, and then you use those clusters to create a structured resampling process. I mean, the whole idea, we focus a lot on portfolio optimization. And the challenge with portfolio optimization is you've got this covariance matrix that each individual element in it actually... actually... has fairly high reliability. But the matrix itself is sparse. And so there's this idea of shrinkage, where you want to shrink the correlations towards some sort of unbiased estimator or unbiased prior. And then the question is, what sort of shrinkage method? How much do you shrink the estimates? So some of these questions can be answered very intuitively by using things like cross-validation. And it's funny because the idea of shrinkage is linked to resampling, is linked to regularization and an optimization process itself. It's linked to constraints. So the long-only constraint, for example, does a miraculous job of producing much more stable portfolios. So much of the literature on optimization that illustrates challenges with optimization doesn't include these really natural constraints that go a very long way to solving the problem and making it very practical.

这其实就是集成、提升和装袋、重采样的概念。这些在技术上是从机器学习文献中衍生出来的思想。但当你在策略设计的过程中走得足够远时，它们实际上就变成了你的第二天性。这不是你...你不会特意去机器学习文献中学习这些概念的名称，然后才开始使用它们。我们已经使用它们多年了。然后当你开始深入研究信息科学和机器学习领域的文献时，你会发现这些概念有其名称，并且有数学上严谨的方法来应用它们，以及衡量这些方法在事前预期收益的方法。我们在这方面投入了相当多的精力。我们也非常依赖诸如装袋无监督学习这样的概念，即你创建相似资产的集群，然后利用这些集群来构建一个结构化的重采样过程。我的意思是，整个理念，我们非常关注投资组合优化。而投资组合优化的挑战在于，你有一个协方差矩阵，其中每个单独的元素实际上...实际上...具有相当高的可靠性。但矩阵本身是稀疏的。因此，这里有一个收缩的概念，你希望将相关性向某种无偏估计量或无偏先验收缩。然后问题来了，使用什么样的收缩方法？你收缩估计的程度是多少？因此，这些问题中的一些可以通过使用诸如交叉验证这样的方法来非常直观地回答。这很有趣，因为收缩的概念与重采样、正则化以及优化过程本身相关联。它与约束条件相关联。例如，仅多头约束在产生更加稳定的投资组合方面做得非常出色。因此，很多关于优化的文献在展示优化挑战时，并没有包含这些非常自然的约束条件，而这些约束条件在解决问题的过程中起到了非常实际的作用，使问题变得非常实际。

Customer
Well, listen, the data is pretty clear. Spot commodity has no risk premium. It delivers returns commensurate with inflation. Futures, long-only futures allocation commodities, does produce a Sharpe ratio over the long term. It's about half the Sharpe ratio of stocks and bonds. And why? For, I think, pretty intuitive reasons. Because producers, commercial producers of commodities want to be able to manage their exposure to price risk. And speculators take on that risk and then harvest a premium for taking on that risk. So for me, there's a real economic intuition for why commodity futures should produce a long-term risk premium. But also, that premium is time-marrying. And so the whole idea of... Carry is that sometimes the premium is negative for certain commodities and for currencies and for rates. And sometimes it's positive. If there's no reason for commodities, why you shouldn't just be allocating toward commodities that produce... That currently have a positive premium if the price doesn't change. And be shorting commodities that have a negative premium if the price doesn't change. And of course, that's the carry strategy. It has the... A Sharpe ratio that's equivalent to the Sharpe ratio on trend over the very long term.

嗯，听我说，数据相当明确。现货商品没有风险溢价。它提供的回报与通胀相符。而期货，仅多头配置的期货商品，确实能在长期内产生夏普比率。这个比率大约是股票和债券夏普比率的一半。为什么呢？我认为，原因相当直观。因为商品的生产商，即商业生产者，希望能够管理他们对价格风险的敞口。而投机者则承担这种风险，并因此获得承担风险的溢价。所以对我来说，商品期货应该产生长期风险溢价，这一经济直觉非常真实。但同时，这种溢价是与时间相关的。因此，整个关于...套利的概念是，有时候某些商品、货币和利率的溢价是负的，而有时候是正的。如果没有理由不这样做，为什么不将资金配置到那些当前具有正溢价的商品上，如果价格不变的话？同时，如果价格不变，为什么不做空那些具有负溢价的商品呢？当然，这就是套利策略。它具有...一个与长期趋势夏普比率相当的夏普比率。
